column4: I keep getting an error when logging in about "Unable to start the settings manager 'gnome-settings-daemon'.

Without the GNOME settings manager running, some preferences may not take effect. This could indicate a problem with Bonobo, or a non-GNOME (e.g. KDE) settings manager may already be active and conflicting with the GNOME settings manager."  Anyone know how to fix this?
not sure how to make it work every time automatically, but you can hit alt+f2 to get a runbox and type gnome-settings-daemon and hit enter and it'll start
That did work! LOL but I dont want to have to do that each time I boot.
